intro: Abarema clypearia f. subacuta, commonly known as the acute-leafed clypearia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, acute leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing pods that contain several seeds. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential ecological roles in native habitats.

This plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in open areas with well-drained soils. It is typically associated with dry to semi-arid environments and is part of the legume family. Its distribution is limited to specific ecological niches within its native range.
